Oh, Brenda, thank you so much for giving me a good chuckle this
morning. It was just what I needed! :D

Tracy in MI


On Nov 28, 2003, at 7:33 PM, Brenda Rose wrote:

> My children have grown up hearing the story about the year when I was
> 10yo that I peeed in my mom's closet and found all my presents. It
> was my worst Xmas ever

messages.msgSnippet: From: zenmomma2kids   Well I am really slow
messages.messageBody:
From: "zenmomma2kids" <zenmomma@...>

<<AFTER I finished pondering, I reread and figured it must have been
peeked. DOH! ROFLMAO>>


Well I am really slow tonight. It wasn't until I got this post of Mary's
that *I* figured out what the hell went on in that closet!!! LOL!!! Thanks
Mary.



Mary B.
http://www.homeschoolingtshirts.com

messages.subject: Re: Xmas Presents
messages.msgSnippet: ... found all my presents.  It was my worst Xmas ever  Okay I read this many times trying to figure out: 1) why a 10 year old was peeing in the closet? and
messages.messageBody:
>>about the year when I was 10yo that I peeed in my mom's closet and
found all my presents. It was my worst Xmas ever >>

Okay I read this many times trying to figure out:

1) why a 10 year old was peeing in the closet?
and
2) how peeing in a closet could possibly cause a person to somehow
discover their hidden presents?
and
3) how the mom could NOT have noticed that a kid peed in her closet?

AFTER I finished pondering, I reread and figured it must have been
peeked. DOH! ROFLMAO

Life is good.
~Mary, off to take the red-eye to Tampa to visit my parents

peeeeeked, I'm guessing.

I love typos like that.

I once referredtothe single male participant on a small e-mail list as "our
lone male member" but it wasn't until I returned after the weekend that I found
I had entertained them all by misspelling "lone" in this way:

"our long male member."


Woohoo!!!

messages.subject: Xmas Presents
messages.msgSnippet: Tina, My children have grown up hearing the story about the year when I was 10yo that I peeed in my mom s closet and found all my presents.  It was my worst
messages.messageBody:
Tina,

My children have grown up hearing the story about the year when I was 10yo that I peeed in my mom's closet and found all my presents. It was my worst Xmas ever - not a single surprise. Like Mary, my mom didn't know until years later. But my kids decided they didn't want to risk it, so they've never really peeked (they do shake packages that are under the tree, tho!).

Maybe you can at least share the stories of how some people are really disappointed when there are no surprises, then ask again if they want you to hold back at least an item or two. If it's still 'no' then they will have whatever natural consequence occurs for them (either disappointment in no surprises or maybe joy that they got to play with things sooner). Good luck!

Brenda in VA

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
